blockEntries.name: target
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of components to include in the instantiated process. The default value 'all' includes all components that are required to form a functional Grafana Mimir instance in single-binary mode. Use the '-modules' command line flag to get a list of available components, and to see which components are included with 'all'.

blockEntries.name: multitenancy_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When set to true, incoming HTTP requests must specify tenant ID in HTTP X-Scope-OrgId header. When set to false, tenant ID from -auth.no-auth-tenant is used instead.

blockEntries.name: no_auth_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Tenant ID to use when multitenancy is disabled.

blockEntries.name: shutdown_delay
blockEntries.desc: How long to wait between SIGTERM and shutdown. After receiving SIGTERM, Mimir will report not-ready status via /ready endpoint.

blockEntries.name: max_separate_metrics_groups_per_user
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of groups allowed per user by which specified distributor and ingester metrics can be further separated.

blockEntries.name: enable_go_runtime_metrics
blockEntries.desc: Set to true to enable all Go runtime metrics, such as go_sched_* and go_memstats_*.

blockEntries.name: skip_label_name_validation_header_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Allows to skip label name validation via X-Mimir-SkipLabelNameValidation header on the http write path. Use with caution as it breaks PromQL. Allowing this for external clients allows any client to send invalid label names. After enabling it, requests with a specific HTTP header set to true will not have label names validated.

blockEntries.name: skip_label_count_validation_header_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Allows to disable enforcement of the label count limit "max_label_names_per_series" via X-Mimir-SkipLabelCountValidation header on the http write path. Allowing this for external clients allows any client to send invalid label counts. After enabling it, requests with a specific HTTP header set to true will not have label counts validated.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Alertmanager ui and api will be served.

blockEntries.name: prometheus_http_prefix
blockEntries.desc: HTTP URL path under which the Prometheus api will be served.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen network, default tcp

blockEntries.name: http_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen address.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server listen port.

blockEntries.name: http_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous http connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_network
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen network

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_address
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen address.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_port
blockEntries.desc: gRPC server listen port.

blockEntries.name: grpc_listen_conn_limit
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous grpc connections, <=0 to disable

blockEntries.name: proxy_protocol_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables PROXY protocol.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of cipher suites to use. If blank, the default Go cipher suites is used.

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Minimum TLS version to use. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13. If blank, the Go TLS minimum version is used.

blockEntries.name: cert
blockEntries.desc: Server TLS certificate. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: key
blockEntries.desc: Server TLS key. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: client_ca
blockEntries.desc: Root certificate authority used to verify client certificates. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: HTTP TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: cert
blockEntries.desc: Server TLS certificate. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: key
blockEntries.desc: Server TLS key. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: client_ca
blockEntries.desc: Root certificate authority used to verify client certificates. This configuration parameter is YAML only.

blockEntries.name: cert_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server cert path.

blockEntries.name: key_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS server key path.

blockEntries.name: client_auth_type
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client Auth type.

blockEntries.name: client_ca_file
blockEntries.desc: GRPC TLS Client CA path.

blockEntries.name: register_instrumentation
blockEntries.desc: Register the intrumentation handlers (/metrics etc).

blockEntries.name: report_grpc_codes_in_instrumentation_label_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If set to true, gRPC statuses will be reported in instrumentation labels with their string representations. Otherwise, they will be reported as "error".

blockEntries.name: graceful_shutdown_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for graceful shutdowns

blockEntries.name: http_server_read_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Read timeout for entire HTTP request, including headers and body.

blockEntries.name: http_server_read_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Read timeout for HTTP request headers. If set to 0, value of -server.http-read-timeout is used.

blockEntries.name: http_server_write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Write timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_server_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Idle timeout for HTTP server

blockEntries.name: http_log_closed_connections_without_response_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Log closed connections that did not receive any response, most likely because client didn't send any request within timeout.

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can receive (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the size of a gRPC message this server can send (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_concurrent_streams
blockEntries.desc: Limit on the number of concurrent streams for gRPC calls per client connection (0 = unlimited)

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_idle
blockEntries.desc: The duration after which an idle connection should be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: The duration for the maximum amount of time a connection may exist before it will be closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_max_connection_age_grace
blockEntries.desc: An additive period after max-connection-age after which the connection will be forcibly closed. Default: infinity

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_time
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which a keepalive probe is sent in case of no activity over the connection., Default: 2h

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_keepalive_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After having pinged for keepalive check, the duration after which an idle connection should be closed, Default: 20s

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_min_time_between_pings
blockEntries.desc: Minimum amount of time a client should wait before sending a keepalive ping. If client sends keepalive ping more often, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_ping_without_stream_allowed
blockEntries.desc: If true, server allows keepalive pings even when there are no active streams(RPCs). If false, and client sends ping when there are no active streams, server will send GOAWAY and close the connection.

blockEntries.name: grpc_server_num_workers
blockEntries.desc: If non-zero, configures the amount of GRPC server workers used to serve the requests.

blockEntries.name: log_format
blockEntries.desc: Output log messages in the given format. Valid formats: [logfmt, json]

blockEntries.name: log_level
blockEntries.desc: Only log messages with the given severity or above. Valid levels: [debug, info, warn, error]

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log the source IPs.

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_full
blockEntries.desc: Log all source IPs instead of only the originating one. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_header
blockEntries.desc: Header field storing the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: log_source_ips_regex
blockEntries.desc: Regex for matching the source IPs. Only used if server.log-source-ips-enabled is true. If not set the default Forwarded, X-Real-IP and X-Forwarded-For headers are used

blockEntries.name: log_request_headers
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log request headers.

blockEntries.name: log_request_at_info_level_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Optionally log requests at info level instead of debug level. Applies to request headers as well if server.log-request-headers is enabled.

blockEntries.name: log_request_exclude_headers_list
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of headers to exclude from loggin. Only used if server.log-request-headers is true.

blockEntries.name: http_path_prefix
blockEntries.desc: Base path to serve all API routes from (e.g. /v1/)

blockEntries.name: client_cleanup_period
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to clean up clients for ingesters that have gone away.

blockEntries.name: health_check_ingesters
blockEntries.desc: Run a health check on each ingester client during periodic cleanup.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables inclusion of the Retry-After header in the response: true includes it for client retry guidance, false omits it.

blockEntries.name: min_backoff
blockEntries.desc: Minimum duration of the Retry-After HTTP header in responses to 429/5xx errors. Must be greater than or equal to 1s. Backoff is calculated as MinBackoff*2^(RetryAttempt-1) seconds with random jitter of 50% in either direction. RetryAttempt is the value of the Retry-Attempt HTTP header.

blockEntries.name: max_backoff
blockEntries.desc: Minimum duration of the Retry-After HTTP header in responses to 429/5xx errors. Must be greater than or equal to 1s. Backoff is calculated as MinBackoff*2^(RetryAttempt-1) seconds with random jitter of 50% in either direction. RetryAttempt is the value of the Retry-Attempt HTTP header.

blockEntries.name: enable_ha_tracker
blockEntries.desc: Enable the distributors HA tracker so that it can accept samples from Prometheus HA replicas gracefully (requires labels).

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Update the timestamp in the KV store for a given cluster/replica only after this amount of time has passed since the current stored timestamp.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_update_timeout_jitter_max
blockEntries.desc: Maximum jitter applied to the update timeout, in order to spread the HA heartbeats over time.

blockEntries.name: ha_tracker_failover_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If we don't receive any samples from the accepted replica for a cluster in this amount of time we will failover to the next replica we receive a sample from. This value must be greater than the update timeout

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: Max message size in bytes that the distributors will accept for incoming push requests to the remote write API. If exceeded, the request will be rejected.

blockEntries.name: max_otlp_request_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum OTLP request size in bytes that the distributors accept. Requests exceeding this limit are rejected.

blockEntries.name: max_request_pool_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: Max size of the pooled buffers used for marshaling write requests. If 0, no max size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: remote_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for downstream ingesters.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which distributors are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring. Default is auto-detected.

blockEntries.name: instance_enable_ipv6
blockEntries.desc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address. (default false)

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that this distributor will accept. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this distributor can handle. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The sum of the request sizes in bytes of inflight push requests that this distributor can handle. This limit is per-distributor, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: write_requests_buffer_pooling_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable pooling of buffers used for marshaling write requests.

blockEntries.name: reusable_ingester_push_workers
blockEntries.desc: Number of pre-allocated workers used to forward push requests to the ingesters. If 0, no workers will be used and a new goroutine will be spawned for each ingester push request. If not enough workers available, new goroutine will be spawned. (Note: this is a performance optimization, not a limiting feature.)

blockEntries.name: query_store_after
blockEntries.desc: The time after which a metric should be queried from storage and not just ingesters. 0 means all queries are sent to store. If this option is enabled, the time range of the query sent to the store-gateway will be manipulated to ensure the query end is not more recent than 'now - query-store-after'.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS for gRPC client connecting to store-gateway.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: shuffle_sharding_ingesters_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Fetch in-memory series from the minimum set of required ingesters, selecting only ingesters which may have received series since -querier.query-ingesters-within. If this setting is false or -querier.query-ingesters-within is '0', queriers always query all ingesters (ingesters shuffle sharding on read path is disabled).

blockEntries.name: streaming_chunks_per_ingester_series_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: Number of series to buffer per ingester when streaming chunks from ingesters.

blockEntries.name: streaming_chunks_per_store_gateway_series_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: Number of series to buffer per store-gateway when streaming chunks from store-gateways.

blockEntries.name: minimize_ingester_requests
blockEntries.desc: If true, when querying ingesters, only the minimum required ingesters required to reach quorum will be queried initially, with other ingesters queried only if needed due to failures from the initial set of ingesters. Enabling this option reduces resource consumption for the happy path at the cost of increased latency for the unhappy path.

blockEntries.name: minimize_ingester_requests_hedging_delay
blockEntries.desc: Delay before initiating requests to further ingesters when request minimization is enabled and the initially selected set of ingesters have not all responded. Ignored if -querier.minimize-ingester-requests is not enabled.

blockEntries.name: query_engine
blockEntries.desc: Query engine to use, either 'prometheus' or 'mimir'

blockEntries.name: enable_query_engine_fallback
blockEntries.desc: If set to true and the Mimir query engine is in use, fall back to using the Prometheus query engine for any queries not supported by the Mimir query engine.

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: The number of workers running in each querier process. This setting limits the maximum number of concurrent queries in each querier. The minimum value is four; lower values are ignored and set to the minimum

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The timeout for a query. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled. This also applies to queries evaluated by the ruler (internally or remotely).

blockEntries.name: max_samples
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of samples a single query can load into memory. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: default_evaluation_interval
blockEntries.desc: The default evaluation interval or step size for subqueries. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: lookback_delta
blockEntries.desc: Time since the last sample after which a time series is considered stale and ignored by expression evaluations. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: promql_experimental_functions_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable experimental PromQL functions. This config option should be set on query-frontend too when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: enable_aggregation_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for aggregation operations in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_vector_vector_binary_comparison_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for binary comparison operations between two vectors in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_vector_scalar_binary_comparison_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for binary comparison operations between a vector and a scalar in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_scalar_scalar_binary_comparison_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for binary comparison operations between two scalars in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_binary_logical_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for binary logical operations in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_scalars
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for scalars in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_subqueries
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for subqueries in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_histogram_quantile_function
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for the histogram_quantile function in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: enable_one_to_many_and_many_to_one_binary_operations
blockEntries.desc: Enable support for one-to-many and many-to-one binary operations (group_left/group_right) in the Mimir query engine. Only applies if the MQE is in use.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy', 's2' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: initial_stream_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: initial_connection_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_base_delay
blockEntries.desc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_max_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which ingesters are skipped for reads/writes. 0 = never (timeout disabled). This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers, and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: replication_factor
blockEntries.desc: Number of ingesters that each time series is replicated to. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers, and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: zone_awareness_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable the zone-awareness and replicate ingested samples across different availability zones. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers, and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: excluded_zones
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of zones to exclude from the ring. Instances in excluded zones will be filtered out from the ring. This option needs be set on ingesters, distributors, queriers, and rulers when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: tokens_file_path
blockEntries.desc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup. Must be empty if -ingester.ring.token-generation-strategy is set to "spread-minimizing".

blockEntries.name: num_tokens
blockEntries.desc: Number of tokens for each ingester.

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring. Default is auto-detected.

blockEntries.name: instance_enable_ipv6
blockEntries.desc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address. (default false)

blockEntries.name: instance_availability_zone
blockEntries.desc: The availability zone where this instance is running.

blockEntries.name: unregister_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: Unregister from the ring upon clean shutdown. It can be useful to disable for rolling restarts with consistent naming.

blockEntries.name: observe_period
blockEntries.desc: Observe tokens after generating to resolve collisions. Useful when using gossiping ring.

blockEntries.name: min_ready_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum duration to wait after the internal readiness checks have passed but before succeeding the readiness endpoint. This is used to slowdown deployment controllers (eg. Kubernetes) after an instance is ready and before they proceed with a rolling update, to give the rest of the cluster instances enough time to receive ring updates.

blockEntries.name: final_sleep
blockEntries.desc: Duration to sleep for before exiting, to ensure metrics are scraped.

blockEntries.name: token_generation_strategy
blockEntries.desc: Specifies the strategy used for generating tokens for ingesters. Supported values are: random,spread-minimizing.

blockEntries.name: spread_minimizing_join_ring_in_order
blockEntries.desc: True to allow this ingester registering tokens in the ring only after all previous ingesters (with ID lower than the current one) have already been registered. This configuration option is supported only when the token generation strategy is set to "spread-minimizing".

blockEntries.name: spread_minimizing_zones
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of zones in which spread minimizing strategy is used for token generation. This value must include all zones in which ingesters are deployed, and must not change over time. This configuration is used only when "token-generation-strategy" is set to "spread-minimizing".

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Etcd username.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Etcd password.

blockEntries.name: primary
blockEntries.desc: Primary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: min_partition_owners_count
blockEntries.desc: Minimum number of owners to wait before a PENDING partition gets switched to ACTIVE.

blockEntries.name: min_partition_owners_duration
blockEntries.desc: How long the minimum number of owners are enforced before a PENDING partition gets switched to ACTIVE.

blockEntries.name: delete_inactive_partition_after
blockEntries.desc: How long to wait before an INACTIVE partition is eligible for deletion. The partition is deleted only if it has been in INACTIVE state for at least the configured duration and it has no owners registered. A value of 0 disables partitions deletion.

blockEntries.name: metadata_retain_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which metadata we have not seen will remain in memory before being deleted.

blockEntries.name: rate_update_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to update the per-tenant ingestion rates.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable tracking of active series and export them as metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_update_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to update active series metrics.

blockEntries.name: active_series_metrics_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: After what time a series is considered to be inactive.

blockEntries.name: tsdb_config_update_period
blockEntries.desc: Period with which to update the per-tenant TSDB configuration.

blockEntries.name: max_ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Max ingestion rate (samples/sec) that ingester will accept. This limit is per-ingester, not per-tenant. Additional push requests will be rejected. Current ingestion rate is computed as exponentially weighted moving average, updated every second. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Max tenants that this ingester can hold. Requests from additional tenants will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_series
blockEntries.desc: Max series that this ingester can hold (across all tenants). Requests to create additional series will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests
blockEntries.desc: Max inflight push requests that this ingester can handle (across all tenants). Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_inflight_push_requests_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The sum of the request sizes in bytes of inflight push requests that this ingester can handle. This limit is per-ingester, not per-tenant. Additional requests will be rejected. 0 = unlimited.

blockEntries.name: ignore_series_limit_for_metric_names
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of metric names, for which the -ingester.max-global-series-per-metric limit will be ignored. Does not affect the -ingester.max-global-series-per-user limit.

blockEntries.name: read_path_cpu_utilization_limit
blockEntries.desc: CPU utilization limit, as CPU cores, for CPU/memory utilization based read request limiting. Use 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: read_path_memory_utilization_limit
blockEntries.desc: Memory limit, in bytes, for CPU/memory utilization based read request limiting. Use 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: error_sample_rate
blockEntries.desc: Each error will be logged once in this many times. Use 0 to log all of them.

blockEntries.name: use_ingester_owned_series_for_limits
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, only series currently owned by ingester according to the ring are used when checking user per-tenant series limit.

blockEntries.name: track_ingester_owned_series
blockEntries.desc: This option enables tracking of ingester-owned series based on ring state, even if -ingester.use-ingester-owned-series-for-limits is disabled.

blockEntries.name: owned_series_update_interval
blockEntries.desc: How often to check for ring changes and possibly recompute owned series as a result of detected change.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable circuit breaking when making requests to ingesters

blockEntries.name: failure_threshold_percentage
blockEntries.desc: Max percentage of requests that can fail over period before the circuit breaker opens

blockEntries.name: failure_execution_threshold
blockEntries.desc: How many requests must have been executed in period for the circuit breaker to be eligible to open for the rate of failures

blockEntries.name: thresholding_period
blockEntries.desc: Moving window of time that the percentage of failed requests is computed over

blockEntries.name: cooldown_period
blockEntries.desc: How long the circuit breaker will stay in the open state before allowing some requests

blockEntries.name: initial_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration, in seconds, after an initial request that an activated circuit breaker should wait before becoming effectively active. During this time, neither failures nor successes are counted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum duration of an ingester's request before it triggers a timeout. This configuration is used for circuit breakers only, and its timeouts aren't reported as errors.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable circuit breaking when making requests to ingesters

blockEntries.name: failure_threshold_percentage
blockEntries.desc: Max percentage of requests that can fail over period before the circuit breaker opens

blockEntries.name: failure_execution_threshold
blockEntries.desc: How many requests must have been executed in period for the circuit breaker to be eligible to open for the rate of failures

blockEntries.name: thresholding_period
blockEntries.desc: Moving window of time that the percentage of failed requests is computed over

blockEntries.name: cooldown_period
blockEntries.desc: How long the circuit breaker will stay in the open state before allowing some requests

blockEntries.name: initial_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration, in seconds, after an initial request that an activated circuit breaker should wait before becoming effectively active. During this time, neither failures nor successes are counted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum duration of an ingester's request before it triggers a timeout. This configuration is used for circuit breakers only, and its timeouts aren't reported as errors.

blockEntries.name: exit_after_flush
blockEntries.desc: Stop after flush has finished. If false, process will keep running, doing nothing.

blockEntries.name: request_rate
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant push request rate limit in requests per second. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: request_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant allowed push request burst size. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_rate
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant ingestion rate limit in samples per second.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant allowed ingestion burst size (in number of samples).

blockEntries.name: ingestion_burst_factor
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant burst factor which is the maximum burst size allowed as a multiple of the per-tenant ingestion rate, this burst-factor must be greater than or equal to 1. If this is set it will override the ingestion-burst-size option.

blockEntries.name: accept_ha_samples
blockEntries.desc: Flag to enable, for all tenants, handling of samples with external labels identifying replicas in an HA Prometheus setup.

blockEntries.name: ha_cluster_label
blockEntries.desc: Prometheus label to look for in samples to identify a Prometheus HA cluster.

blockEntries.name: ha_replica_label
blockEntries.desc: Prometheus label to look for in samples to identify a Prometheus HA replica.

blockEntries.name: ha_max_clusters
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of clusters that HA tracker will keep track of for a single tenant. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: drop_labels
blockEntries.desc: This flag can be used to specify label names that to drop during sample ingestion within the distributor and can be repeated in order to drop multiple labels.

blockEntries.name: max_label_name_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for label names

blockEntries.name: max_label_value_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for label value. This setting also applies to the metric name

blockEntries.name: max_label_names_per_series
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of label names per series.

blockEntries.name: max_label_names_per_info_series
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of label names per info series. Has no effect if less than the value of the maximum number of label names per series option (-validation.max-label-names-per-series)

blockEntries.name: max_metadata_length
blockEntries.desc: Maximum length accepted for metric metadata. Metadata refers to Metric Name, HELP and UNIT. Longer metadata is dropped except for HELP which is truncated.

blockEntries.name: max_native_histogram_buckets
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of buckets per native histogram sample. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: max_exemplars_per_series_per_request
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of exemplars per series per request. 0 to disable limit in request. The exceeding exemplars are dropped.

blockEntries.name: reduce_native_histogram_over_max_buckets
blockEntries.desc: Whether to reduce or reject native histogram samples with more buckets than the configured limit.

blockEntries.name: creation_grace_period
blockEntries.desc: Controls how far into the future incoming samples and exemplars are accepted compared to the wall clock. Any sample or exemplar will be rejected if its timestamp is greater than '(now + creation_grace_period)'. This configuration is enforced in the distributor and ingester.

blockEntries.name: past_grace_period
blockEntries.desc: Controls how far into the past incoming samples and exemplars are accepted compared to the wall clock. Any sample or exemplar will be rejected if its timestamp is lower than '(now - OOO window - past_grace_period)'. This configuration is enforced in the distributor and ingester. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: enforce_metadata_metric_name
blockEntries.desc: Enforce every metadata has a metric name.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size used by shuffle-sharding. This value is the total size of the shard (ie. it is not the number of ingesters in the shard per zone, but the number of ingesters in the shard across all zones, if zone-awareness is enabled). Must be set both on ingesters and distributors. 0 disables shuffle sharding.

blockEntries.name: metric_relabel_configs
blockEntries.desc: List of metric relabel configurations. Note that in most situations, it is more effective to use metrics relabeling directly in the Prometheus server, e.g. remote_write.write_relabel_configs. Labels available during the relabeling phase and cleaned afterwards: __meta_tenant_id

blockEntries.name: metric_relabeling_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable metric relabeling for the tenant. This configuration option can be used to forcefully disable metric relabeling on a per-tenant basis.

blockEntries.name: service_overload_status_code_on_rate_limit_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, rate limit errors will be reported to the client with HTTP status code 529 (Service is overloaded). If disabled, status code 429 (Too Many Requests) is used. Enabling -distributor.retry-after-header.enabled before utilizing this option is strongly recommended as it helps prevent premature request retries by the client.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of in-memory series per tenant, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_series_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of in-memory series per metric name, across the cluster before replication. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of in-memory metrics with metadata per tenant, across the cluster. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_metadata_per_metric
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of metadata per metric, across the cluster. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_global_exemplars_per_user
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of exemplars in memory, across the cluster. 0 to disable exemplars ingestion.

blockEntries.name: ignore_ooo_exemplars
blockEntries.desc: Whether to ignore exemplars with out-of-order timestamps. If enabled, exemplars with out-of-order timestamps are silently dropped, otherwise they cause partial errors.

blockEntries.name: native_histograms_ingestion_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable ingestion of native histogram samples. If false, native histogram samples are ignored without an error. To query native histograms with query-sharding enabled make sure to set -query-frontend.query-result-response-format to 'protobuf'.

blockEntries.name: ooo_native_histograms_ingestion_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable experimental out-of-order native histogram ingestion. This only takes effect if the `-ingester.out-of-order-time-window` value is greater than zero and if `-ingester.native-histograms-ingestion-enabled = true`

blockEntries.name: active_series_custom_trackers
blockEntries.desc: Additional custom trackers for active metrics. If there are active series matching a provided matcher (map value), the count will be exposed in the custom trackers metric labeled using the tracker name (map key). Zero valued counts are not exposed (and removed when they go back to zero).
blockEntries.fieldType: map of tracker name (string) to matcher (string)

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_time_window
blockEntries.desc: Non-zero value enables out-of-order support for most recent samples that are within the time window in relation to the TSDB's maximum time, i.e., within [db.maxTime-timeWindow, db.maxTime]). The ingester will need more memory as a factor of rate of out-of-order samples being ingested and the number of series that are getting out-of-order samples. If query falls into this window, cached results will use value from -query-frontend.results-cache-ttl-for-out-of-order-time-window option to specify TTL for resulting cache entry.

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_blocks_external_label_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Whether the shipper should label out-of-order blocks with an external label before uploading them. Setting this label will compact out-of-order blocks separately from non-out-of-order blocks

blockEntries.name: separate_metrics_group_label
blockEntries.desc: Label used to define the group label for metrics separation. For each write request, the group is obtained from the first non-empty group label from the first timeseries in the incoming list of timeseries. Specific distributor and ingester metrics will be further separated adding a 'group' label with group label's value. Currently applies to the following metrics: cortex_discarded_samples_total

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunks_per_query
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of chunks that can be fetched in a single query from ingesters and store-gateways. This limit is enforced in the querier, ruler and store-gateway. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_estimated_fetched_chunks_per_query_multiplier
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of chunks estimated to be fetched in a single query from ingesters and store-gateways, as a multiple of -querier.max-fetched-chunks-per-query. This limit is enforced in the querier. Must be greater than or equal to 1, or 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_series_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of unique series for which a query can fetch samples from ingesters and store-gateways. This limit is enforced in the querier, ruler and store-gateway. 0 to disable

blockEntries.name: max_fetched_chunk_bytes_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of all chunks in bytes that a query can fetch from ingesters and store-gateways. This limit is enforced in the querier and ruler. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_estimated_memory_consumption_per_query
blockEntries.desc: The maximum estimated memory a single query can consume at once, in bytes. This limit is only enforced when Mimir's query engine is in use. This limit is enforced in the querier. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_query_lookback
blockEntries.desc: Limit how long back data (series and metadata) can be queried, up until <lookback> duration ago. This limit is enforced in the query-frontend, querier and ruler for instant, range and remote read queries. For metadata queries like series, label names, label values queries the limit is enforced in the querier and ruler. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail but will be manipulated to only query data within the allowed time range. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_partial_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the time range for partial queries at the querier level.

blockEntries.name: max_query_parallelism
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of split (by time) or partial (by shard) queries that will be scheduled in parallel by the query-frontend for a single input query. This limit is introduced to have a fairer query scheduling and avoid a single query over a large time range saturating all available queriers.

blockEntries.name: max_labels_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the time range (end - start time) of series, label names and values queries. This limit is enforced in the querier. If the requested time range is outside the allowed range, the request will not fail but will be manipulated to only query data within the allowed time range. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: max_cache_freshness
blockEntries.desc: Most recent allowed cacheable result per-tenant, to prevent caching very recent results that might still be in flux.

blockEntries.name: max_queriers_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of queriers that can handle requests for a single tenant. If set to 0 or value higher than number of available queriers, *all* queriers will handle requests for the tenant. Each frontend (or query-scheduler, if used) will select the same set of queriers for the same tenant (given that all queriers are connected to all frontends / query-schedulers). This option only works with queriers connecting to the query-frontend / query-scheduler, not when using downstream URL.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_total_shards
blockEntries.desc: The amount of shards to use when doing parallelisation via query sharding by tenant. 0 to disable query sharding for tenant. Query sharding implementation will adjust the number of query shards based on compactor shards. This allows querier to not search the blocks which cannot possibly have the series for given query shard.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_max_sharded_queries
blockEntries.desc: The max number of sharded queries that can be run for a given received query. 0 to disable limit.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_max_regexp_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Disable query sharding for any query containing a regular expression matcher longer than the configured number of bytes. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: split_instant_queries_by_interval
blockEntries.desc: Split instant queries by an interval and execute in parallel. 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: query_ingesters_within
blockEntries.desc: Maximum lookback beyond which queries are not sent to ingester. 0 means all queries are sent to ingester.

blockEntries.name: max_total_query_length
blockEntries.desc: Limit the total query time range (end - start time). This limit is enforced in the query-frontend on the received instant, range or remote read query.

blockEntries.name: results_cache_ttl
blockEntries.desc: Time to live duration for cached query results. If query falls into out-of-order time window, -query-frontend.results-cache-ttl-for-out-of-order-time-window is used instead.

blockEntries.name: results_cache_ttl_for_out_of_order_time_window
blockEntries.desc: Time to live duration for cached query results if query falls into out-of-order time window. This is lower than -query-frontend.results-cache-ttl so that incoming out-of-order samples are returned in the query results sooner.

blockEntries.name: results_cache_ttl_for_cardinality_query
blockEntries.desc: Time to live duration for cached cardinality query results. The value 0 disables the cache.

blockEntries.name: results_cache_ttl_for_labels_query
blockEntries.desc: Time to live duration for cached label names and label values query results. The value 0 disables the cache.

blockEntries.name: results_cache_ttl_for_errors
blockEntries.desc: Time to live duration for cached non-transient errors

blockEntries.name: cache_unaligned_requests
blockEntries.desc: Cache requests that are not step-aligned.

blockEntries.name: max_query_expression_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size of the raw query, in bytes. This limit is enforced by the query-frontend for instant, range and remote read queries. 0 to not apply a limit to the size of the query.

blockEntries.name: blocked_queries
blockEntries.desc: List of queries to block.

blockEntries.name: align_queries_with_step
blockEntries.desc: Mutate incoming queries to align their start and end with their step to improve result caching.

blockEntries.name: enabled_promql_experimental_functions
blockEntries.desc: Enable certain experimental PromQL functions, which are subject to being changed or removed at any time, on a per-tenant basis. Defaults to empty which means all experimental functions are disabled. Set to 'all' to enable all experimental functions.

blockEntries.name: cardinality_analysis_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables endpoints used for cardinality analysis.

blockEntries.name: label_names_and_values_results_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of distinct label names and values. When querier receives response from ingester, it merges the response with responses from other ingesters. This maximum size limit is applied to the merged(distinct) results. If the limit is reached, an error is returned.

blockEntries.name: label_values_max_cardinality_label_names_per_request
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of label names allowed to be queried in a single /api/v1/cardinality/label_values API call.

blockEntries.name: active_series_results_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of an active series or active native histogram series request result shard in bytes. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: cost_attribution_labels
blockEntries.desc: Defines labels for cost attribution. Applies to metrics like cortex_received_attributed_samples_total. To disable, set to an empty string. For example, 'team,service' produces metrics such as cortex_received_attributed_samples_total{team='frontend', service='api'}.

blockEntries.name: max_cost_attribution_labels_per_user
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of cost attribution labels allowed per user, the value is capped at 4.

blockEntries.name: max_cost_attribution_cardinality_per_user
blockEntries.desc: Maximum cardinality of cost attribution labels allowed per user.

blockEntries.name: cost_attribution_cooldown
blockEntries.desc: Cooldown period for cost attribution labels. Specifies the duration the cost attribution remains in overflow before attempting a reset. If the cardinality remains above the limit after this period, the system stays in overflow mode and extends the cooldown. Setting this value to 0 disables the cooldown, causing the system to continuously check whether the cardinality has dropped below the limit. A reset occurs when the cardinality falls below the limit.

blockEntries.name: ruler_evaluation_delay_duration
blockEntries.desc: Duration to delay the evaluation of rules to ensure the underlying metrics have been pushed.

blockEntries.name: ruler_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size when sharding is used by ruler. Value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant, and tenant rules will be sharded across all ruler replicas.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rules_per_rule_group
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rules per rule group per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rule_groups_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rule groups per-tenant. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ruler_recording_rules_evaluation_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Controls whether recording rules evaluation is enabled. This configuration option can be used to forcefully disable recording rules evaluation on a per-tenant basis.

blockEntries.name: ruler_alerting_rules_evaluation_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Controls whether alerting rules evaluation is enabled. This configuration option can be used to forcefully disable alerting rules evaluation on a per-tenant basis.

blockEntries.name: ruler_sync_rules_on_changes_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable a re-sync of the configured rule groups as soon as they're changed via ruler's config API. This re-sync is in addition of the periodic syncing. When enabled, it may take up to few tens of seconds before a configuration change triggers the re-sync.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rules_per_rule_group_by_namespace
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rules per rule group by namespace. Value is a map, where each key is the namespace and value is the number of rules allowed in the namespace (int). On the command line, this map is given in a JSON format. The number of rules specified has the same meaning as -ruler.max-rules-per-rule-group, but only applies for the specific namespace. If specified, it supersedes -ruler.max-rules-per-rule-group.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_rule_groups_per_tenant_by_namespace
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of rule groups per tenant by namespace. Value is a map, where each key is the namespace and value is the number of rule groups allowed in the namespace (int). On the command line, this map is given in a JSON format. The number of rule groups specified has the same meaning as -ruler.max-rule-groups-per-tenant, but only applies for the specific namespace. If specified, it supersedes -ruler.max-rule-groups-per-tenant.

blockEntries.name: ruler_protected_namespaces
blockEntries.desc: List of namespaces that are protected from modification unless a special HTTP header is used. If a namespace is protected, it can only be read, not modified via the ruler's configuration API. The value is a list of strings, where each string is a namespace name. On the command line, this list is given as a comma-separated list.

blockEntries.name: ruler_max_independent_rule_evaluation_concurrency_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of independent rules that can run concurrently for each tenant. Depends on ruler.max-independent-rule-evaluation-concurrency being greater than 0. Ideally this flag should be a lower value. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: store_gateway_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The tenant's shard size, used when store-gateway sharding is enabled. Value of 0 disables shuffle sharding for the tenant, that is all tenant blocks are sharded across all store-gateway replicas.

blockEntries.name: compactor_blocks_retention_period
blockEntries.desc: Delete blocks containing samples older than the specified retention period. Also used by query-frontend to avoid querying beyond the retention period by instant, range or remote read queries. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: compactor_split_and_merge_shards
blockEntries.desc: The number of shards to use when splitting blocks. 0 to disable splitting.

blockEntries.name: compactor_split_groups
blockEntries.desc: Number of groups that blocks for splitting should be grouped into. Each group of blocks is then split separately. Number of output split shards is controlled by -compactor.split-and-merge-shards.

blockEntries.name: compactor_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: Max number of compactors that can compact blocks for single tenant. 0 to disable the limit and use all compactors.

blockEntries.name: compactor_partial_block_deletion_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a partial block (unfinished block without meta.json file) hasn't been modified for this time, it will be marked for deletion. The minimum accepted value is 4h0m0s: a lower value will be ignored and the feature disabled. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: compactor_block_upload_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable block upload API for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: compactor_block_upload_validation_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable block upload validation for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: compactor_block_upload_verify_chunks
blockEntries.desc: Verify chunks when uploading blocks via the upload API for the tenant.

blockEntries.name: compactor_block_upload_max_block_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of a block that is allowed to be uploaded or validated. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_type
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption type. Required to enable server-side encryption overrides for a specific tenant. If not set, the default S3 client settings are used.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS Key ID. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: s3_sse_kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: S3 server-side encryption KMS encryption context. If unset and the key ID override is set, the encryption context will not be provided to S3. Ignored if the SSE type override is not set.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_cidr_networks
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of network CIDRs to block in Alertmanager receiver integrations.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_receivers_firewall_block_private_addresses
blockEntries.desc: True to block private and local addresses in Alertmanager receiver integrations. It blocks private addresses defined by  RFC 1918 (IPv4 addresses) and RFC 4193 (IPv6 addresses), as well as loopback, local unicast and local multicast addresses.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Per-tenant rate limit for sending notifications from Alertmanager in notifications/sec. 0 = rate limit disabled. Negative value = no notifications are allowed.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_notification_rate_limit_per_integration
blockEntries.desc: Per-integration notification rate limits. Value is a map, where each key is integration name and value is a rate-limit (float). On command line, this map is given in JSON format. Rate limit has the same meaning as -alertmanager.notification-rate-limit, but only applies for specific integration. Allowed integration names: webhook, email, pagerduty, opsgenie, wechat, slack, victorops, pushover, sns, webex, telegram, discord, msteams.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_grafana_config_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of the Grafana Alertmanager configuration for a tenant. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_config_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of the Alertmanager configuration for a tenant. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_grafana_state_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of the Grafana Alertmanager state for a tenant. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_silences_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of silences, including expired silences, that a tenant can have at once. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_silence_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum silence size in bytes. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_templates_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of templates in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_template_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of single template in tenant's Alertmanager configuration uploaded via Alertmanager API. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_dispatcher_aggregation_groups
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of aggregation groups in Alertmanager's dispatcher that a tenant can have. Each active aggregation group uses single goroutine. When the limit is reached, dispatcher will not dispatch alerts that belong to additional aggregation groups, but existing groups will keep working properly. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_count
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of alerts that a single tenant can have. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: alertmanager_max_alerts_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum total size of alerts that a single tenant can have, alert size is the sum of the bytes of its labels, annotations and generatorURL. Inserting more alerts will fail with a log message and metric increment. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: otel_metric_suffixes_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Whether to enable automatic suffixes to names of metrics ingested through OTLP.

blockEntries.name: otel_created_timestamp_zero_ingestion_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Whether to enable translation of OTel start timestamps to Prometheus zero samples in the OTLP endpoint.

blockEntries.name: promote_otel_resource_attributes
blockEntries.desc: Optionally specify OTel resource attributes to promote to labels.

blockEntries.name: otel_keep_identifying_resource_attributes
blockEntries.desc: Whether to keep identifying OTel resource attributes in the target_info metric on top of converting to job and instance labels.

blockEntries.name: ingest_storage_read_consistency
blockEntries.desc: The default consistency level to enforce for queries when using the ingest storage. Supports values: strong, eventual.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_partitions_tenant_shard_size
blockEntries.desc: The number of partitions a tenant's data should be sharded to when using the ingest storage. Tenants are sharded across partitions using shuffle-sharding. 0 disables shuffle sharding and tenant is sharded across all partitions.

blockEntries.name: frontend_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of the query-frontend component, in host:port format. If multiple query-frontends are running, the host should be a DNS resolving to all query-frontend instances. This option should be set only when query-scheduler component is not in use.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of the query-scheduler component, in host:port format. The host should resolve to all query-scheduler instances. This option should be set only when query-scheduler component is in use and -query-scheduler.service-discovery-mode is set to 'dns'.

blockEntries.name: dns_lookup_duration
blockEntries.desc: How often to query DNS for query-frontend or query-scheduler address.

blockEntries.name: id
blockEntries.desc: Querier ID, sent to the query-frontend to identify requests from the same querier. Defaults to hostname.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy', 's2' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: initial_stream_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: initial_connection_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_base_delay
blockEntries.desc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_max_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy', 's2' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: initial_stream_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: initial_connection_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
