blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_base_delay
blockEntries.desc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_max_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: response_streaming_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enables streaming of responses from querier to query-frontend for response types that support it (currently only `active_series` responses do).

blockEntries.name: log_queries_longer_than
blockEntries.desc: Log queries that are slower than the specified duration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to < 0 to enable on all queries.

blockEntries.name: log_query_request_headers
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of request header names to include in query logs. Applies to both query stats and slow queries logs.

blockEntries.name: max_body_size
blockEntries.desc: Max body size for downstream prometheus.

blockEntries.name: query_stats_enabled
blockEntries.desc: False to disable query statistics tracking. When enabled, a message with some statistics is logged for every query.

blockEntries.name: active_series_write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for writing active series responses. 0 means the value from `-server.http-write-timeout` is used.

blockEntries.name: max_outstanding_per_tenant
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of outstanding requests per tenant per frontend; requests beyond this error with HTTP 429.

blockEntries.name: querier_forget_delay
blockEntries.desc: If a querier disconnects without sending notification about graceful shutdown, the query-frontend will keep the querier in the tenant's shard until the forget delay has passed. This feature is useful to reduce the blast radius when shuffle-sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_address
blockEntries.desc: Address of the query-scheduler component, in host:port format. The host should resolve to all query-scheduler instances. This option should be set only when query-scheduler component is in use and -query-scheduler.service-discovery-mode is set to 'dns'.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_dns_lookup_period
blockEntries.desc: How often to resolve the scheduler-address, in order to look for new query-scheduler instances.

blockEntries.name: scheduler_worker_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of concurrent workers forwarding queries to single query-scheduler.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy', 's2' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: initial_stream_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: initial_connection_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_base_delay
blockEntries.desc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_max_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address. This address is sent to query-scheduler and querier, which uses it to send the query response back to query-frontend.

blockEntries.name: instance_enable_ipv6
blockEntries.desc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address (default false).

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise to the querier (via scheduler) (default is auto-detected from network interfaces).

blockEntries.name: port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise to querier (via scheduler) (defaults to server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: split_queries_by_interval
blockEntries.desc: Split range queries by an interval and execute in parallel. You should use a multiple of 24 hours to optimize querying blocks. 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for query-frontend results cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached, redis.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of memcached addresses. Each address can be an IP address, hostname, or an entry specified in the DNS Service Discovery format.

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The connection timeout.

blockEntries.name: write_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The size of the write buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: read_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The size of the read buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: min_idle_connections_headroom_percentage
blockEntries.desc: The minimum number of idle connections to keep open as a percentage (0-100) of the number of recently used idle connections. If negative, idle connections are kept open indefinitely.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached, in bytes. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable connecting to Memcached with TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:

- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384

- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: Redis Server or Cluster configuration endpoint to use for caching. A comma-separated list of endpoints for Redis Cluster or Redis Sentinel.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Username to use when connecting to Redis.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Password to use when connecting to Redis.

blockEntries.name: db
blockEntries.desc: Database index.

blockEntries.name: master_name
blockEntries.desc: Redis Sentinel master name. An empty string for Redis Server or Redis Cluster.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client dial timeout.

blockEntries.name: read_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client read timeout.

blockEntries.name: write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client write timeout.

blockEntries.name: connection_pool_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections in the pool.

blockEntries.name: connection_pool_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait to get a connection from pool.

blockEntries.name: min_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Minimum number of idle connections.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Amount of time after which client closes idle connections.

blockEntries.name: max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in Redis. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size per batch for mget operations.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable connecting to Redis with TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: compression
blockEntries.desc: Enable cache compression, if not empty. Supported values are: snappy.

blockEntries.name: cache_results
blockEntries.desc: Cache query results.

blockEntries.name: cache_errors
blockEntries.desc: Cache non-transient errors from queries.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of retries for a single request; beyond this, the downstream error is returned.

blockEntries.name: not_running_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for the query-frontend to become ready before rejecting requests received before the frontend was ready. 0 to disable (i.e. fail immediately if a request is received while the frontend is still starting up)

blockEntries.name: parallelize_shardable_queries
blockEntries.desc: True to enable query sharding.

blockEntries.name: prune_queries
blockEntries.desc: True to enable pruning dead code (eg. expressions that cannot produce any results) and simplifying expressions (eg. expressions that can be evaluated immediately) in queries.

blockEntries.name: block_promql_experimental_functions
blockEntries.desc: True to control access to specific PromQL experimental functions per tenant.

blockEntries.name: query_sharding_target_series_per_shard
blockEntries.desc: How many series a single sharded partial query should load at most. This is not a strict requirement guaranteed to be honoured by query sharding, but a hint given to the query sharding when the query execution is initially planned. 0 to disable cardinality-based hints.

blockEntries.name: shard_active_series_queries
blockEntries.desc: True to enable sharding of active series queries.

blockEntries.name: use_active_series_decoder
blockEntries.desc: Set to true to use the zero-allocation response decoder for active series queries.

blockEntries.name: query_result_response_format
blockEntries.desc: Format to use when retrieving query results from queriers. Supported values: json, protobuf

blockEntries.name: downstream_url
blockEntries.desc: URL of downstream Prometheus.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable the ingestion via object storage.

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: The Kafka backend address.

blockEntries.name: topic
blockEntries.desc: The Kafka topic name.

blockEntries.name: client_id
blockEntries.desc: The Kafka client ID.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum time allowed to open a connection to a Kafka broker.

blockEntries.name: write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long to wait for an incoming write request to be successfully committed to the Kafka backend.

blockEntries.name: write_clients
blockEntries.desc: The number of Kafka clients used by producers. When the configured number of clients is greater than 1, partitions are sharded among Kafka clients. A higher number of clients may provide higher write throughput at the cost of additional Metadata requests pressure to Kafka.

blockEntries.name: sasl_username
blockEntries.desc: The username used to authenticate to Kafka using the SASL plain mechanism. To enable SASL, configure both the username and password.

blockEntries.name: sasl_password
blockEntries.desc: The password used to authenticate to Kafka using the SASL plain mechanism. To enable SASL, configure both the username and password.

blockEntries.name: consumer_group
blockEntries.desc: The consumer group used by the consumer to track the last consumed offset. The consumer group must be different for each ingester. If the configured consumer group contains the '<partition>' placeholder, it is replaced with the actual partition ID owned by the ingester. When empty (recommended), Mimir uses the ingester instance ID to guarantee uniqueness.

blockEntries.name: consumer_group_offset_commit_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently a consumer should commit the consumed offset to Kafka. The last committed offset is used at startup to continue the consumption from where it was left.

blockEntries.name: last_produced_offset_poll_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to poll the last produced offset, used to enforce strong read consistency.

blockEntries.name: last_produced_offset_retry_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long to retry a failed request to get the last produced offset.

blockEntries.name: consume_from_position_at_startup
blockEntries.desc: From which position to start consuming the partition at startup. Supported options: last-offset, start, end, timestamp.

blockEntries.name: consume_from_timestamp_at_startup
blockEntries.desc: Milliseconds timestamp after which the consumption of the partition starts at startup. Only applies when consume-from-position-at-startup is timestamp

blockEntries.name: target_consumer_lag_at_startup
blockEntries.desc: The best-effort maximum lag a consumer tries to achieve at startup. Set both -ingest-storage.kafka.target-consumer-lag-at-startup and -ingest-storage.kafka.max-consumer-lag-at-startup to 0 to disable waiting for maximum consumer lag being honored at startup.

blockEntries.name: max_consumer_lag_at_startup
blockEntries.desc: The guaranteed maximum lag before a consumer is considered to have caught up reading from a partition at startup, becomes ACTIVE in the hash ring and passes the readiness check. Set both -ingest-storage.kafka.target-consumer-lag-at-startup and -ingest-storage.kafka.max-consumer-lag-at-startup to 0 to disable waiting for maximum consumer lag being honored at startup.

blockEntries.name: auto_create_topic_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable auto-creation of Kafka topic on startup if it doesn't exist. If creating the topic fails and the topic doesn't already exist, Mimir will fail to start.

blockEntries.name: auto_create_topic_default_partitions
blockEntries.desc: When auto-creation of Kafka topic is enabled and this value is positive, Mimir will create the topic with this number of partitions. When the value is -1 the Kafka broker will use the default number of partitions (num.partitions configuration).

blockEntries.name: producer_max_record_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of a Kafka record data that should be generated by the producer. An incoming write request larger than this size is split into multiple Kafka records. We strongly recommend to not change this setting unless for testing purposes.

blockEntries.name: producer_max_buffered_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of (uncompressed) buffered and unacknowledged produced records sent to Kafka. The produce request fails once this limit is reached. This limit is per Kafka client. 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: wait_strong_read_consistency_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum allowed for a read requests processed by an ingester to wait until strong read consistency is enforced. 0 to disable the timeout.

blockEntries.name: fetch_concurrency_max
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent fetch requests that the ingester makes when reading data from Kafka during startup. Concurrent fetch requests are issued only when there is sufficient backlog of records to consume. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: use_compressed_bytes_as_fetch_max_bytes
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, the fetch request MaxBytes field is computed using the compressed size of previous records. When disabled, MaxBytes is computed using uncompressed bytes. Different Kafka implementations interpret MaxBytes differently.

blockEntries.name: max_buffered_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of buffered records ready to be processed. This limit applies to the sum of all inflight requests. Set to 0 to disable the limit.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_concurrency_max
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent ingestion streams to the TSDB head. Every tenant has their own set of streams. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_concurrency_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The number of timeseries to batch together before ingesting to the TSDB head. Only use this setting when -ingest-storage.kafka.ingestion-concurrency-max is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_concurrency_queue_capacity
blockEntries.desc: The number of batches to prepare and queue to ingest to the TSDB head. Only use this setting when -ingest-storage.kafka.ingestion-concurrency-max is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_concurrency_target_flushes_per_shard
blockEntries.desc: The expected number of times to ingest timeseries to the TSDB head after batching. With fewer flushes, the overhead of splitting up the work is higher than the benefit of parallelization. Only use this setting when -ingest-storage.kafka.ingestion-concurrency-max is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: ingestion_concurrency_estimated_bytes_per_sample
blockEntries.desc: The estimated number of bytes a sample has at time of ingestion. This value is used to estimate the timeseries without decompressing them. Only use this setting when -ingest-storage.kafka.ingestion-concurrency-max is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: distributor_send_to_ingesters_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When both this option and ingest storage are enabled, distributors write to both Kafka and ingesters. A write request is considered successful only when written to both backends.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use. Supported backends are: s3, gcs, azure, swift, filesystem.

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: S3 bucket name

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: S3 secret access key

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 access key ID

blockEntries.name: session_token
blockEntries.desc: S3 session token

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: list_objects_version
blockEntries.desc: Use a specific version of the S3 list object API. Supported values are v1 or v2. Default is unset.

blockEntries.name: bucket_lookup_type
blockEntries.desc: Bucket lookup style type, used to access bucket in S3-compatible service. Default is auto. Supported values are: auto, path, virtual-hosted.

blockEntries.name: dualstack_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, direct all AWS S3 requests to the dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 endpoint for the configured region.

blockEntries.name: storage_class
blockEntries.desc: The S3 storage class to use, not set by default. Details can be found at https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/. Supported values are: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, GLACIER, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR, SNOW, EXPRESS_ONEZONE

blockEntries.name: native_aws_auth_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, it will use the default authentication methods of the AWS SDK for go based on known environment variables and known AWS config files.

blockEntries.name: part_size
blockEntries.desc: The minimum file size in bytes used for multipart uploads. If 0, the value is optimally computed for each object.

blockEntries.name: send_content_md5
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, a Content-MD5 header is sent with S3 Put Object requests. Consumes more resources to compute the MD5, but may improve compatibility with object storage services that do not support checksums.

blockEntries.name: sts_endpoint

blockEntries.name: type

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time an idle connection remains idle before closing.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client waits for a server's response headers.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to object storage via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client accepts any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.name: tls_handshake_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: expect_continue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. Set to 0 to send the request body immediately.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. Set to 0 to use a built-in default value of 2.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the Certificate Authority (CA) certificates to validate the server certificate. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which is used for authenticating with the server. This setting also requires you to configure the key path.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. This setting also requires you to configure the client certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, low-level S3 HTTP operation information is logged at the debug level.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: GCS bucket name

blockEntries.name: service_account
blockEntries.desc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic:
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

blockEntries.desc: Name of the OpenStack Swift container to put chunks in.

blockEntries.desc: Max retries on requests error.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which a connection attempt is aborted.

blockEntries.name: request_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Time after which an idle request is aborted. The timeout watchdog is reset each time some data is received, so the timeout triggers after X time no data is received on a request.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Local filesystem storage directory.

blockEntries.name: storage_prefix
blockEntries.desc: Prefix for all objects stored in the backend storage. For simplicity, it may only contain digits and English alphabet letters.

blockEntries.name: sync_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store synchronized TSDB index headers. This directory is not required to be persisted between restarts, but it's highly recommended in order to improve the store-gateway startup time.

blockEntries.name: sync_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently to scan the bucket, or to refresh the bucket index (if enabled), in order to look for changes (new blocks shipped by ingesters and blocks deleted by retention or compaction).

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent queries to execute against the long-term storage. The limit is shared across all tenants.

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent_queue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for the queue of queries waiting for execution. If the queue is full and the timeout is reached, the query will be retried on another store-gateway. 0 means no timeout and all queries will wait indefinitely for their turn.

blockEntries.name: tenant_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent tenants synching blocks.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent blocks synching per tenant.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from object storage per tenant.

blockEntries.desc: The index cache backend type. Supported values: inmemory, memcached, redis.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of memcached addresses. Each address can be an IP address, hostname, or an entry specified in the DNS Service Discovery format.

blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The connection timeout.

blockEntries.desc: The size of the write buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: read_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The size of the read buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: min_idle_connections_headroom_percentage
blockEntries.desc: The minimum number of idle connections to keep open as a percentage (0-100) of the number of recently used idle connections. If negative, idle connections are kept open indefinitely.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached, in bytes. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: max_get_range_requests
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of sub-GetRange requests that a single GetRange request can be split into when fetching chunks. Zero or negative value = unlimited number of sub-requests.

blockEntries.name: attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching object attributes for chunks. If the metadata cache is configured, attributes will be stored under this cache backend, otherwise attributes are stored in the chunks cache backend.

blockEntries.name: attributes_in_memory_max_items
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of object attribute items to keep in a first level in-memory LRU cache. Metadata will be stored and fetched in-memory before hitting the cache backend. 0 to disable the in-memory cache.

blockEntries.name: subrange_ttl
blockEntries.desc: TTL for caching individual chunks subranges.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend for metadata cache, if not empty. Supported values: memcached, redis.

blockEntries.name: addresses
blockEntries.desc: Comma-separated list of memcached addresses. Each address can be an IP address, hostname, or an entry specified in the DNS Service Discovery format.

blockEntries.name: timeout
blockEntries.desc: The socket read/write timeout.

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The connection timeout.

blockEntries.name: write_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The size of the write buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: read_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The size of the read buffer (in bytes). The buffer is allocated for each connection to memcached.

blockEntries.name: min_idle_connections_headroom_percentage
blockEntries.desc: The minimum number of idle connections to keep open as a percentage (0-100) of the number of recently used idle connections. If negative, idle connections are kept open indefinitely.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of idle connections that will be maintained per address.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of keys a single underlying get operation should run. If more keys are specified, internally keys are split into multiple batches and fetched concurrently, honoring the max concurrency. If set to 0, the max batch size is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in memcached, in bytes. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable connecting to Memcached with TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: Redis Server or Cluster configuration endpoint to use for caching. A comma-separated list of endpoints for Redis Cluster or Redis Sentinel.

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: Username to use when connecting to Redis.

blockEntries.name: password
blockEntries.desc: Password to use when connecting to Redis.

blockEntries.name: db
blockEntries.desc: Database index.

blockEntries.name: master_name
blockEntries.desc: Redis Sentinel master name. An empty string for Redis Server or Redis Cluster.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client dial timeout.

blockEntries.name: read_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client read timeout.

blockEntries.name: write_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Client write timeout.

blockEntries.name: connection_pool_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections in the pool.

blockEntries.name: connection_pool_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait to get a connection from pool.

blockEntries.name: min_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Minimum number of idle connections.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Amount of time after which client closes idle connections.

blockEntries.name: max_connection_age
blockEntries.desc: Close connections older than this duration. If the value is zero, then the pool does not close connections based on age.

blockEntries.name: max_item_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size of an item stored in Redis. Bigger items are not stored. If set to 0, no maximum size is enforced.

blockEntries.name: max_async_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent asynchronous operations can occur.

blockEntries.name: max_async_buffer_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of enqueued asynchronous operations allowed.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of concurrent connections running get operations. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: max_get_multi_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: The maximum size per batch for mget operations.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable connecting to Redis with TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA

- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: tenants_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of tenants in the bucket.

blockEntries.name: tenant_blocks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of blocks for each tenant.

blockEntries.name: chunks_list_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache list of chunks for a block.

blockEntries.name: metafile_exists_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile exists. Also used for tenant deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_doesnt_exist_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache information that block metafile doesn't exist. Also used for tenant deletion mark file.

blockEntries.name: metafile_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the metafile.

blockEntries.name: metafile_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of metafile content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: metafile_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block metafile.

blockEntries.name: block_index_attributes_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache attributes of the block index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_content_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache content of the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: bucket_index_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size of bucket index content to cache in bytes. Caching will be skipped if the content exceeds this size. This is useful to avoid network round trip for large content if the configured caching backend has an hard limit on cached items size (in this case, you should set this limit to the same limit in the caching backend).

blockEntries.name: ignore_deletion_mark_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which the blocks marked for deletion will be filtered out while fetching blocks. The idea of ignore-deletion-marks-delay is to ignore blocks that are marked for deletion with some delay. This ensures store can still serve blocks that are meant to be deleted but do not have a replacement yet.

blockEntries.name: ignore_deletion_mark_while_querying_delay
blockEntries.desc: Duration after which blocks marked for deletion will still be queried. This ensures queriers still query blocks that are meant to be deleted but do not have a replacement yet.

blockEntries.name: update_on_error_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently a bucket index, which previously failed to load, should be tried to load again. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: How long a unused bucket index should be cached. Once this timeout expires, the unused bucket index is removed from the in-memory cache. This option is used only by querier.

blockEntries.name: max_stale_period
blockEntries.desc: The maximum allowed age of a bucket index (last updated) before queries start failing because the bucket index is too old. The bucket index is periodically updated by the compactor, and this check is enforced in the querier (at query time).

blockEntries.name: ignore_blocks_within
blockEntries.desc: Blocks with minimum time within this duration are ignored, and not loaded by store-gateway. Useful when used together with -querier.query-store-after to prevent loading young blocks, because there are usually many of them (depending on number of ingesters) and they are not yet compacted. Negative values or 0 disable the filter.

blockEntries.name: series_hash_cache_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of the in-memory series hash cache. The cache is shared across all tenants and it's used only when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: partitioner_max_gap_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of a gap for which the partitioner aggregates together two bucket GET object requests.

blockEntries.name: postings_offsets_in_mem_sampling
blockEntries.desc: Controls what is the ratio of postings offsets that the store will hold in memory.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_file_handles
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle file handles the store-gateway keeps open for each index-header file.

blockEntries.name: eager_loading_startup_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, store-gateway will periodically persist block IDs of lazy loaded index-headers and load them eagerly during startup. Ignored if index-header lazy loading is disabled.

blockEntries.name: lazy_loading_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, store-gateway will lazy load an index-header only once required by a query.

blockEntries.name: lazy_loading_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If index-header lazy loading is enabled and this setting is > 0, the store-gateway will offload unused index-headers after 'idle timeout' inactivity.

blockEntries.name: lazy_loading_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of concurrent index header loads across all tenants. If set to 0, concurrency is unlimited.

blockEntries.name: lazy_loading_concurrency_queue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for the queue of index header loads. If the queue is full and the timeout is reached, the load will return an error. 0 means no timeout and the load will wait indefinitely.

blockEntries.name: verify_on_load
blockEntries.desc: If true, verify the checksum of index headers upon loading them (either on startup or lazily when lazy loading is enabled). Setting to true helps detect disk corruption at the cost of slowing down index header loading.

blockEntries.name: streaming_series_batch_size
blockEntries.desc: This option controls how many series to fetch per batch. The batch size must be greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: series_fetch_preference
blockEntries.desc: This parameter controls the trade-off in fetching series versus fetching postings to fulfill a series request. Increasing the series preference results in fetching more series and reducing the volume of postings fetched. Reducing the series preference results in the opposite. Increase this parameter to reduce the rate of fetched series bytes (see "Mimir / Queries" dashboard) or API calls to the object store. Must be a positive floating point number.

blockEntries.name: dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to store TSDBs (including WAL) in the ingesters. This directory is required to be persisted between restarts.

blockEntries.name: retention_period
blockEntries.desc: TSDB blocks retention in the ingester before a block is removed. If shipping is enabled, the retention will be relative to the time when the block was uploaded to storage. If shipping is disabled then its relative to the creation time of the block. This should be larger than the -blocks-storage.tsdb.block-ranges-period, -querier.query-store-after and large enough to give store-gateways and queriers enough time to discover newly uploaded blocks.

blockEntries.name: ship_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently the TSDB blocks are scanned and new ones are shipped to the storage. 0 means shipping is disabled.

blockEntries.name: ship_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently shipping blocks to the storage.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently the ingester checks whether the TSDB head should be compacted and, if so, triggers the compaction. Mimir applies a jitter to the first check, and subsequent checks will happen at the configured interval. A block is only created if data covers the smallest block range. The configured interval must be between 0 and 15 minutes.

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of tenants concurrently compacting TSDB head into a new block

blockEntries.name: head_compaction_idle_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB head is idle for this duration, it is compacted. Note that up to 25% jitter is added to the value to avoid ingesters compacting concurrently. 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_write_buffer_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: The write buffer size used by the head chunks mapper. Lower values reduce memory utilisation on clusters with a large number of tenants at the cost of increased disk I/O operations. The configured buffer size must be between 65536 and 8388608.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_end_time_variance
blockEntries.desc: How much variance (as percentage between 0 and 1) should be applied to the chunk end time, to spread chunks writing across time. Doesn't apply to the last chunk of the chunk range. 0 means no variance.

blockEntries.name: stripe_size
blockEntries.desc: The number of shards of series to use in TSDB (must be a power of 2). Reducing this will decrease memory footprint, but can negatively impact performance.

blockEntries.name: wal_compression_enabled
blockEntries.desc: True to enable TSDB WAL compression.

blockEntries.name: wal_segment_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: TSDB WAL segments files max size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: wal_replay_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of CPUs that can simultaneously processes WAL replay. If it is set to 0, then each TSDB is replayed with a concurrency equal to the number of CPU cores available on the machine.

blockEntries.name: flush_blocks_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: True to flush blocks to storage on shutdown. If false, incomplete blocks will be reused after restart.

blockEntries.name: close_idle_tsdb_timeout
blockEntries.desc: If TSDB has not received any data for this duration, and all blocks from TSDB have been shipped, TSDB is closed and deleted from local disk. If set to positive value, this value should be equal or higher than -querier.query-ingesters-within flag to make sure that TSDB is not closed prematurely, which could cause partial query results. 0 or negative value disables closing of idle TSDB.

blockEntries.name: memory_snapshot_on_shutdown
blockEntries.desc: True to enable snapshotting of in-memory TSDB data on disk when shutting down.

blockEntries.name: head_chunks_write_queue_size
blockEntries.desc: The size of the write queue used by the head chunks mapper. Lower values reduce memory utilisation at the cost of potentially higher ingest latency. Value of 0 switches chunks mapper to implementation without a queue.

blockEntries.name: bigger_out_of_order_blocks_for_old_samples
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, ingester produces 24h blocks for out-of-order data that is before the current day, instead of the usual 2h blocks.

blockEntries.name: series_hash_cache_max_size_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Max size - in bytes - of the in-memory series hash cache. The cache is shared across all tenants and it's used only when query sharding is enabled.

blockEntries.name: out_of_order_capacity_max
blockEntries.desc: Maximum capacity for out of order chunks, in samples between 1 and 255.

blockEntries.name: head_postings_for_matchers_cache_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache postings for matchers in the Head and OOOHead. 0 disables the cache and just deduplicates the in-flight calls.

blockEntries.name: head_postings_for_matchers_cache_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of entries in the cache for postings for matchers in the Head and OOOHead when TTL is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: head_postings_for_matchers_cache_max_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of the cache for postings for matchers in the Head and OOOHead when TTL is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: head_postings_for_matchers_cache_force
blockEntries.desc: Force the cache to be used for postings for matchers in the Head and OOOHead, even if it's not a concurrent (query-sharding) call.

blockEntries.name: block_postings_for_matchers_cache_ttl
blockEntries.desc: How long to cache postings for matchers in each compacted block queried from the ingester. 0 disables the cache and just deduplicates the in-flight calls.

blockEntries.name: block_postings_for_matchers_cache_size
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of entries in the cache for postings for matchers in each compacted block when TTL is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: block_postings_for_matchers_cache_max_bytes
blockEntries.desc: Maximum size in bytes of the cache for postings for matchers in each compacted block when TTL is greater than 0.

blockEntries.name: block_postings_for_matchers_cache_force
blockEntries.desc: Force the cache to be used for postings for matchers in compacted blocks, even if it's not a concurrent (query-sharding) call.

blockEntries.name: early_head_compaction_min_in_memory_series
blockEntries.desc: When the number of in-memory series in the ingester is equal to or greater than this setting, the ingester tries to compact the TSDB Head. The early compaction removes from the memory all samples and inactive series up until -ingester.active-series-metrics-idle-timeout time ago. After an early compaction, the ingester will not accept any sample with a timestamp older than -ingester.active-series-metrics-idle-timeout time ago (unless out of order ingestion is enabled). The ingester checks every -blocks-storage.tsdb.head-compaction-interval whether an early compaction is required. Use 0 to disable it.

blockEntries.name: early_head_compaction_min_estimated_series_reduction_percentage
blockEntries.desc: When the early compaction is enabled, the early compaction is triggered only if the estimated series reduction is at least the configured percentage (0-100).

blockEntries.name: timely_head_compaction_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Allows head compaction to happen when the min block range can no longer be appended, without requiring 1.5x the chunk range worth of data in the head.

blockEntries.name: block_ranges
blockEntries.desc: List of compaction time ranges.

blockEntries.name: block_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when downloading blocks for compaction and uploading resulting blocks.

blockEntries.name: meta_sync_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of Go routines to use when syncing block meta files from the long term storage.

blockEntries.name: data_dir
blockEntries.desc: Directory to temporarily store blocks during compaction. This directory is not required to be persisted between restarts.

blockEntries.name: compaction_interval
blockEntries.desc: The frequency at which the compaction runs

blockEntries.name: compaction_retries
blockEntries.desc: How many times to retry a failed compaction within a single compaction run.

blockEntries.name: compaction_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of concurrent compactions running.

blockEntries.name: first_level_compaction_wait_period
blockEntries.desc: How long the compactor waits before compacting first-level blocks that are uploaded by the ingesters. This configuration option allows for the reduction of cases where the compactor begins to compact blocks before all ingesters have uploaded their blocks to the storage.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_interval
blockEntries.desc: How frequently the compactor should run blocks cleanup and maintenance, as well as update the bucket index.

blockEntries.name: cleanup_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of tenants for which blocks cleanup and maintenance should run concurrently.

blockEntries.name: deletion_delay
blockEntries.desc: Time before a block marked for deletion is deleted from bucket. If not 0, blocks will be marked for deletion and the compactor component will permanently delete blocks marked for deletion from the bucket. If 0, blocks will be deleted straight away. Note that deleting blocks immediately can cause query failures.

blockEntries.name: tenant_cleanup_delay
blockEntries.desc: For tenants marked for deletion, this is the time between deletion of the last block, and doing final cleanup (marker files, debug files) of the tenant.

blockEntries.name: max_compaction_time
blockEntries.desc: Max time for starting compactions for a single tenant. After this time no new compactions for the tenant are started before next compaction cycle. This can help in multi-tenant environments to avoid single tenant using all compaction time, but also in single-tenant environments to force new discovery of blocks more often. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: no_blocks_file_cleanup_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, will delete the bucket-index, markers and debug files in the tenant bucket when there are no blocks left in the index.

blockEntries.name: max_opening_blocks_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of goroutines opening blocks before compaction.

blockEntries.name: max_closing_blocks_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of blocks that can be closed concurrently during split compaction. Note that closing a newly compacted block uses a lot of memory for writing the index.

blockEntries.name: symbols_flushers_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of symbols flushers used when doing split compaction.

blockEntries.name: max_block_upload_validation_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Max number of uploaded blocks that can be validated concurrently. 0 = no limit.

blockEntries.name: enabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that can be compacted. If specified, only these tenants will be compacted by the compactor, otherwise all tenants can be compacted. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: disabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that cannot be compacted by the compactor. If specified, and the compactor would normally pick a given tenant for compaction (via -compactor.enabled-tenants or sharding), it will be ignored instead.

blockEntries.name: store
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use for the ring. Supported values are: consul, etcd, inmemory, memberlist, multi.

blockEntries.name: prefix
blockEntries.desc: The prefix for the keys in the store. Should end with a /.

blockEntries.name: host
blockEntries.desc: Hostname and port of Consul.

blockEntries.name: acl_token
blockEntries.desc: ACL Token used to interact with Consul.

blockEntries.name: http_client_timeout
blockEntries.desc: HTTP timeout when talking to Consul

blockEntries.name: consistent_reads
blockEntries.desc: Enable consistent reads to Consul.

blockEntries.name: watch_rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit when watching key or prefix in Consul, in requests per second. 0 disables the rate limit.

blockEntries.name: watch_burst_size
blockEntries.desc: Burst size used in rate limit. Values less than 1 are treated as 1.

blockEntries.name: cas_retry_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum duration to wait before retrying a Compare And Swap (CAS) operation.

blockEntries.name: endpoints
blockEntries.desc: The etcd endpoints to connect to.

blockEntries.name: dial_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The dial timeout for the etcd connection.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: The maximum number of retries to do for failed ops.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path

blockEntries.desc: The replication factor to use when sharding blocks. This option needs be set both on the store-gateway, querier and ruler when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.desc: File path where tokens are stored. If empty, tokens are not stored at shutdown and restored at startup.

blockEntries.desc: Number of tokens for each store-gateway.

blockEntries.desc: True to enable zone-awareness and replicate blocks across different availability zones. This option needs be set both on the store-gateway, querier and ruler when running in microservices mode.

blockEntries.name: auto_forget_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, a store-gateway is automatically removed from the ring after failing to heartbeat the ring for a period longer than 10 times the configured -store-gateway.sharding-ring.heartbeat-timeout.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_min_duration
blockEntries.desc: Minimum time to wait for ring stability at startup, if set to positive value.

blockEntries.name: wait_stability_max_duration
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for ring stability at startup. If the store-gateway ring keeps changing after this period of time, the store-gateway will start anyway.

blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that can be loaded by the store-gateway. If specified, only blocks for these tenants will be loaded by the store-gateway, otherwise all tenants can be loaded. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: disabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants that cannot be loaded by the store-gateway. If specified, and the store-gateway would normally load a given tenant for (via -store-gateway.enabled-tenants or sharding), it will be ignored instead.

blockEntries.name: max_concurrent
blockEntries.desc: The number of workers used for each tenant federated query. This setting limits the maximum number of per-tenant queries executed at a time for a tenant federated query.

blockEntries.name: max_tenants

blockEntries.name: secondary
blockEntries.desc: Secondary backend storage used by multi-client.

blockEntries.name: mirror_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Mirror writes to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: mirror_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Timeout for storing value to secondary store.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_period
blockEntries.desc: Period at which to heartbeat to the ring. 0 = disabled.

blockEntries.name: heartbeat_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The heartbeat timeout after which rulers are considered unhealthy within the ring. 0 = never (timeout disabled).

blockEntries.name: instance_id
blockEntries.desc: Instance ID to register in the ring.

blockEntries.name: instance_interface_names
blockEntries.desc: List of network interface names to look up when finding the instance IP address.

blockEntries.name: instance_port
blockEntries.desc: Port to advertise in the ring (defaults to -server.grpc-listen-port).

blockEntries.name: instance_addr
blockEntries.desc: IP address to advertise in the ring. Default is auto-detected.

blockEntries.name: instance_enable_ipv6
blockEntries.desc: Enable using a IPv6 instance address. (default false)

blockEntries.name: num_tokens
blockEntries.desc: Number of tokens for each ruler.

blockEntries.name: enable_api
blockEntries.desc: Enable the ruler config API.

blockEntries.name: enabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants whose rules this ruler can evaluate. If specified, only these tenants will be handled by ruler, otherwise this ruler can process rules from all tenants. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: disabled_tenants
blockEntries.desc: Comma separated list of tenants whose rules this ruler cannot evaluate. If specified, a ruler that would normally pick the specified tenant(s) for processing will ignore them instead. Subject to sharding.

blockEntries.name: query_stats_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Report the wall time for ruler queries to complete as a per-tenant metric and as an info level log message.

blockEntries.name: address
blockEntries.desc: GRPC listen address of the query-frontend(s). Must be a DNS address (prefixed with dns:///) to enable client side load balancing.

blockEntries.name: max_recv_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max receive message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: max_send_msg_size
blockEntries.desc: gRPC client max send message size (bytes).

blockEntries.name: grpc_compression
blockEntries.desc: Use compression when sending messages. Supported values are: 'gzip', 'snappy', 's2' and '' (disable compression)

blockEntries.name: rate_limit
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit for gRPC client; 0 means disabled.

blockEntries.name: rate_limit_burst
blockEntries.desc: Rate limit burst for gRPC client.

blockEntries.name: backoff_on_ratelimits
blockEntries.desc: Enable backoff and retry when we hit rate limits.

blockEntries.name: min_period
blockEntries.desc: Minimum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_period
blockEntries.desc: Maximum delay when backing off.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of times to backoff and retry before failing.

blockEntries.name: initial_stream_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial stream window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: initial_connection_window_size
blockEntries.desc: Initial connection window size. Values less than the default are not supported and are ignored. Setting this to a value other than the default disables the BDP estimator.

blockEntries.name: tls_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable TLS in the gRPC client. This flag needs to be enabled when any other TLS flag is set. If set to false, insecure connection to gRPC server will be used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which will be used for authenticating with the server. Also requires the key path to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. Also requires the client certificate to be configured.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the CA certificates to validate server certificate against. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: Skip validating server certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_cipher_suites
blockEntries.desc:
Override the default cipher suite list (separated by commas). Allowed values:

Secure Ciphers:
- TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256

Insecure Ciphers:
- TLS_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
- TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
- TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
- TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256

blockEntries.name: tls_min_version
blockEntries.desc: Override the default minimum TLS version. Allowed values: VersionTLS10, VersionTLS11, VersionTLS12, VersionTLS13

blockEntries.name: connect_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The maximum amount of time to establish a connection. A value of 0 means default gRPC client connect timeout and backoff.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_base_delay
blockEntries.desc: Initial backoff delay after first connection failure. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: connect_backoff_max_delay
blockEntries.desc: Maximum backoff delay when establishing a connection. Only relevant if ConnectTimeout > 0.

blockEntries.name: query_result_response_format
blockEntries.desc: Format to use when retrieving query results from query-frontends. Supported values: json, protobuf

blockEntries.name: max_retries_rate
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of retries for failed queries per second.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: Enable rule groups to query against multiple tenants. The tenant IDs involved need to be in the rule group's 'source_tenants' field. If this flag is set to 'false' when there are federated rule groups that already exist, then these rules groups will be skipped during evaluations.

blockEntries.name: outbound_sync_queue_poll_interval
blockEntries.desc: Interval between sending queued rule sync requests to ruler replicas.

blockEntries.name: inbound_sync_queue_poll_interval
blockEntries.desc: Interval between applying queued incoming rule sync requests.

blockEntries.name: max_independent_rule_evaluation_concurrency
blockEntries.desc: Number of rules rules that don't have dependencies that we allow to be evaluated concurrently across all tenants. 0 to disable.

blockEntries.name: independent_rule_evaluation_concurrency_min_duration_percentage
blockEntries.desc: Minimum threshold of the interval to last rule group runtime duration to allow a rule to be evaluated concurrency. By default, the rule group runtime duration must exceed 50.0% of the evaluation interval.

blockEntries.name: rule_evaluation_write_enabled
blockEntries.desc: Writes the results of rule evaluation to ingesters or ingest storage when enabled. Use this option for testing purposes. To disable, set to false.

blockEntries.name: backend
blockEntries.desc: Backend storage to use. Supported backends are: s3, gcs, azure, swift, filesystem, local.

blockEntries.name: endpoint
blockEntries.desc: The S3 bucket endpoint. It could be an AWS S3 endpoint listed at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html or the address of an S3-compatible service in hostname:port format.

blockEntries.name: region
blockEntries.desc: S3 region. If unset, the client will issue a S3 GetBucketLocation API call to autodetect it.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: S3 bucket name

blockEntries.name: secret_access_key
blockEntries.desc: S3 secret access key

blockEntries.name: access_key_id
blockEntries.desc: S3 access key ID

blockEntries.name: session_token
blockEntries.desc: S3 session token

blockEntries.name: insecure
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, use http:// for the S3 endpoint instead of https://. This could be useful in local dev/test environments while using an S3-compatible backend storage, like Minio.

blockEntries.name: signature_version
blockEntries.desc: The signature version to use for authenticating against S3. Supported values are: v4, v2.

blockEntries.name: list_objects_version
blockEntries.desc: Use a specific version of the S3 list object API. Supported values are v1 or v2. Default is unset.

blockEntries.name: bucket_lookup_type
blockEntries.desc: Bucket lookup style type, used to access bucket in S3-compatible service. Default is auto. Supported values are: auto, path, virtual-hosted.

blockEntries.name: dualstack_enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, direct all AWS S3 requests to the dual-stack IPv4/IPv6 endpoint for the configured region.

blockEntries.name: storage_class
blockEntries.desc: The S3 storage class to use, not set by default. Details can be found at https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/. Supported values are: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, GLACIER, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS, GLACIER_IR, SNOW, EXPRESS_ONEZONE

blockEntries.name: native_aws_auth_enabled
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, it will use the default authentication methods of the AWS SDK for go based on known environment variables and known AWS config files.

blockEntries.name: part_size
blockEntries.desc: The minimum file size in bytes used for multipart uploads. If 0, the value is optimally computed for each object.

blockEntries.name: send_content_md5
blockEntries.desc: If enabled, a Content-MD5 header is sent with S3 Put Object requests. Consumes more resources to compute the MD5, but may improve compatibility with object storage services that do not support checksums.

blockEntries.name: sts_endpoint
blockEntries.desc: Accessing S3 resources using temporary, secure credentials provided by AWS Security Token Service.

blockEntries.name: type
blockEntries.desc: Enable AWS Server Side Encryption. Supported values: SSE-KMS, SSE-S3.

blockEntries.name: kms_key_id
blockEntries.desc: KMS Key ID used to encrypt objects in S3

blockEntries.name: kms_encryption_context
blockEntries.desc: KMS Encryption Context used for object encryption. It expects JSON formatted string.

blockEntries.name: idle_conn_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time an idle connection remains idle before closing.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client waits for a server's response headers.

blockEntries.name: insecure_skip_verify
blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to object storage via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client accepts any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.name: tls_handshake_timeout
blockEntries.desc: Maximum time to wait for a TLS handshake. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: expect_continue_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The time to wait for a server's first response headers after fully writing the request headers if the request has an Expect header. Set to 0 to send the request body immediately.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections across all hosts. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: max_idle_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of idle (keep-alive) connections to keep per-host. Set to 0 to use a built-in default value of 2.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: tls_ca_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the Certificate Authority (CA) certificates to validate the server certificate. If not set, the host's root CA certificates are used.

blockEntries.name: tls_cert_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the client certificate, which is used for authenticating with the server. This setting also requires you to configure the key path.

blockEntries.name: tls_key_path
blockEntries.desc: Path to the key for the client certificate. This setting also requires you to configure the client certificate.

blockEntries.name: tls_server_name
blockEntries.desc: Override the expected name on the server certificate.

blockEntries.name: enabled
blockEntries.desc: When enabled, low-level S3 HTTP operation information is logged at the debug level.

blockEntries.name: bucket_name
blockEntries.desc: GCS bucket name

blockEntries.name: service_account
blockEntries.desc:
JSON either from a Google Developers Console client_credentials.json file, or a Google Developers service account key. Needs to be valid JSON, not a filesystem path. If empty, fallback to Google default logic:
1. A JSON file whose path is specified by the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable. For workload identity federation, refer to https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/how-to#using-workload-identity-federation on how to generate the JSON configuration file for on-prem/non-Google cloud platforms.
2. A JSON file in a location known to the gcloud command-line tool: $HOME/.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json.
3. On Google Compute Engine it fetches credentials from the metadata server.

blockEntries.desc: If the client connects to object storage via HTTPS and this option is enabled, the client accepts any certificate and hostname.

blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.name: account_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account name

blockEntries.name: account_key
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage account key. If unset, Azure managed identities will be used for authentication instead.

blockEntries.name: connection_string
blockEntries.desc: If `connection-string` is set, the value of `endpoint-suffix` will not be used. Use this method over `account-key` if you need to authenticate via a SAS token. Or if you use the Azurite emulator.

blockEntries.name: container_name
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage container name

blockEntries.name: endpoint_suffix
blockEntries.desc: Azure storage endpoint suffix without schema. The account name will be prefixed to this value to create the FQDN. If set to empty string, default endpoint suffix is used.

blockEntries.name: max_retries
blockEntries.desc: Number of retries for recoverable errors

blockEntries.name: user_assigned_id
blockEntries.desc: User assigned managed identity. If empty, then System assigned identity is used.

blockEntries.name: response_header_timeout
blockEntries.desc: The amount of time the client waits for a server's response headers.

blockEntries.name: max_connections_per_host
blockEntries.desc: Maximum number of connections per host. Set to 0 for no limit.

blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift application credential id

blockEntries.name: application_credential_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift application credential name

blockEntries.name: application_credential_secret
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift application credential secret

blockEntries.name: auth_version
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication API version. 0 to autodetect.

blockEntries.name: auth_url
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift authentication URL

blockEntries.name: username
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift username.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_name
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.

blockEntries.name: user_domain_id
blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user ID.

blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain ID.

blockEntries.desc: OpenStack Swift user's domain name.
